snippet: In an apparent dig at the artist Damien Hirst, much of whose work is produced by assistants, posters for an upcoming exhibition of paintings by David Hockney at the Royal Academy of Arts in London include a note that reads, "All the works here were...
abstract: In an apparent dig at the artist Damien Hirst, much of whose work is produced by assistants, posters for an upcoming exhibition of paintings by David Hockney at the Royal Academy of Arts in London include a note that reads, "All the works here were made by the artist himself, personally."
lead_paragraph: The art world has generally come to accept that some pieces are produced by people who work for the artists they are attributed to, rather than the artists themselves. Not David Hockney. Posters for his upcoming exhibition at the Royal Academy of Arts in London include an apparent dig at the artist Damien Hirst, The Guardian reported on Monday, in the form of a note that reads, "All the works here were made by the artist himself, personally."

headline.main: Hockney Tweaks Hirst Over Authorship of Art
